name: A. Three Strings
statement:
You are given three strings a, b and c of the same length n. The strings
consist of lowercase English letters only. The i-th letter of a is a_i,
the i-th letter of b is b_i, the i-th letter of c is c_i.For every i (1
leq i
leq n) you swap (i.e. exchange) c_i with either a_i or b_i. So in total
you’ll perform exactly n swap operations, each of them either c_i
leftrightarrow a_i or c_i
leftrightarrow b_i (i iterates over all integers between 1 and n,
inclusive).For example, if a is "", b is "", and c is "", you can make c
equal to "" taking the 1-st and the 4-th letters from a and the others
from b. In this way a becomes "" and b becomes "".Is it possible that
after these swaps the string a becomes exactly the same as the string b?
